meanings.definition: To censor or obscure offensive language in a broadcast.
meanings.sent1: The TV station bleeped out the swear words during the live show.
meanings.sent2: The radio host quickly bleeped the inappropriate language before it aired.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his mom would bleep his jokes if they were too rude.
meanings.sent4: The teacher bleeped out any mention of the answer to keep the quiz fair.
meanings.sent5: The software automatically bleeped any profanity in the chat messages.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, the machine bleeped loudly when it finished its task.
meanings.sent2: The alarm bleeped repeatedly until someone turned it off.
meanings.sent3: The robot bleeped happily after completing its assigned job.
meanings.sent4: The microwave bleeped to signal that the food was ready to eat.
meanings.sent5: The phone bleeped with a new message notification.
